subject: Re: [junit] Re: How can I join developping group?
msgSnippet: ... Have you tried submitting patches? I see that you have created Feature Requests on Sourceforge, but I can t see any associated patch. I think that might be
messageBody:
On 04/04/2008, toalexsmail <toalexsmail@...> wrote:
>
> Waiting for your explanation how I can fill in missing javadoc and to
> write automatic tests.

Have you tried submitting patches? I see that you have created Feature
Requests on Sourceforge, but I can't see any associated patch. I think
that might be a good place to start.

In my experience, very few open source projects grant write access to
the version control system willy-nilly. Instead, people create
relationships with the existing development team by submitting
patches, having a discussion with the dev team about improvements /
why the patch was rejected and so on, until eventually the contributor
may be deemed worthy of becoming a fully-fledged committer on the
project. I would imagine JUnit has a similar tradition, although of
course any of the existing development team are free to point out any
misconception I have here.

Cheers,

James
